text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the model to highlight that an occupier must have a right 'at the time of the disposition'. The candidate answer addresses this by discussing the potential overriding interest under Schedule 3, Paragraph 2 of the LRA 2002, stating: 'A person in actual occupation at the time of purchase may have an overriding interest... However, you were arguably not in actual occupation at the time of purchase \u2013 you were in Asia.' This directly addresses the requirement that the right (in this case, actual occupation constituting an overriding interest) must exist at the time of the disposition (the purchase).", "criterion_id": "b1d17dc7-cd11-411d-88af-47cab931fcfe"}
